Module capstone.schedulemanager
Package capstone.schedulemanager.dao

Class CustomersData

java.lang.Object
capstone.schedulemanager.dao.CustomersData
public abstract class CustomersData extends Object
This class provides methods to access and manipulate customers data from the customers table on the mysql database.

  • Method Details

    • getCustList

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customers> getCustList()
      This method acquires all rows from the customers table and converts them to objects stored on an observable list. LAMBDA EXPRESSION 1 (getConversion()): Converts Timestamp objects to Local Date Time objects. This expression is used for code reuse and simplification.
      Returns:
      customers The list of all customers data from the customers table on the mysql database

    • insertCust

      public static int insertCust(String custNam, String address, String postal, String phone, LocalDateTime createDate, String createBy, LocalDateTime lastUpdt, String lastUpdtBy, int divId, int custId)
      This method queries the database to insert a newly created customer from data acquired in the application into the customers table on the mysql database. If the insert is successful it returns an integer number of the rows affected.
      Parameters:
      divId - The customer's division ID
      lastUpdtBy - The user that last updated the customer information
      lastUpdt - The date and time that the customer informationw as last updated
      custId - The customer's ID
      address - The customer's address
      createBy - The user that initially created the customer's data profile
      createDate - The date and time that the customer was initially created in the system
      custNam - The name of the customer
      phone - The customer's phone number
      postal - The customer's postal code
      Returns:
      rowsAffected The affected row count

    • getCustomerName

      public static String getCustomerName(int custId)
      This method returns the customer's name that matches the input customer ID.
      Parameters:
      custId - The customer ID to reference
      Returns:
      name The name of the customer

    • updateCustomer

      public static int updateCustomer(int customerId, String custName, String address, String postal, String phone, LocalDateTime lastUpdt, String lastUpdtBy, int divId)
      This method queries the database to update an existing customer on the customer table with data acquired from the application. If the update is successful the method returns a number of the rows affected by the query.
      Parameters:
      postal - The updated postal code
      phone - The updated phone number
      address - The updated address
      lastUpdt - The updated last update date and time
      divId - The updated division ID
      lastUpdtBy - The updated last user to update
      customerId - The customer ID of the date being updated
      custName - The name of the customer being updated
      Returns:
      rowsAffected The affected row count

    • deleteCustomer

      public static int deleteCustomer(int customerId)
      This method queries the database to delete a customer whose customer ID matches the inputted customer ID. If successful this method returns a row count of the rows affected by the delete.
      Parameters:
      customerId - The customer's ID to delete
      Returns:
      rowsAffected The row count of rows affected by the delete

    • getNextCustId

      public static int getNextCustId()
      This method returns the number of the next customer ID to be added the customers table.
      Returns:
      lastNum + 1 The highest customer ID number plus 1

    • getCustWithNmLst

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<CustsWthNms> getCustWithNmLst()
      This method creates and returns an observable list of all customers in the database with the names of their associated divisions and countries.
      Returns:
      The list of customers
